content:
ICS 1C HW 2 for Gabe Potyondy

About the author

Name: Gabe Potyondy
E-mail: easu1570@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Economics

Three neat Web finds:

  1. Top ten reasons why you should hang out on the internet.
  2. Experimental Stock market data.
  3. Touring the world on the Web with The Virtual Tourist.

Questions I can now answer:
  1. What are the most popular spices for the various cuisines in Hungary?
  2. What are the advantages of having a hotlist and what is an example of another person's hotlist?
  3. How can you search for various types of information on the Web with only key words and no URL's?
  4. Where can I get information on Bank of America and get access to the location of the various branches and Versateller machines?
  5. Where can I find information on the cost and benefits of using the Internet?
  1. What are the most popular spices for the various cuisines in Hungary? The two most popular spices in Hungary are paprika and garlic. Strings of ungrinded red pepper are hung to dry and then crushed. These crushed red peppers are what is commonly referred to as paprika. Paprika is a key ingredient to Goulash, which is one of the most famous Hungarian dishes. Although goulash was originally a soup, it has turned into a hearty stew. Now, people commonly add plenty of meat, carrots, and potatoes to goulash. Goulash is just one of the many delicious cuisines from Hungary.

    Return to list of questions.

  2. What are the advantages of having a hotlist and what is an example of another person's hotlist? On the World Wide Web, searching for useful information is one of the most tedious tasks. Once you've found a site that interests you, it is important to remember where it is located. Luckily, there is an efficient way of marking and going to certain sites quickly. The quick way of accessing other systems is by putting the URL of the system onto a hotlist. Professor Franklin's hotlist is an example of a well made and informative hotlist of various sites on the Web.

    Return to list of questions.

  3. How can you search for various types of information on the Web with only key words and no URL's? In order to be able to go to various sites on the World Wide Web, it is necessary to have the URL's of the various servers. There is a very useful tool available on the Web to anyone who wants to use it; this tool is called the Webcrawler. The Webcrawler allows you to search for various servers on the Web that have information on topics that you find interesting. For example, if you wanted information on music, then you could type the word music in Webcrawler and it will send you to servers that contain information on music. If you are interested in other valuable resources then check this out.

    Return to list of questions.

  4. Where can I get information on Bank of America and get access to the location of the various branch and Versateller machines? In my opinion, Bank of America is a good bank because it offers a wide variety of services for it's customers. Bank of America is the second largest bank in the United States, with assets of $219 billion. It has roughly 1900 retail branches in the Western United States and a network of 5500 Versateller machines. In order to be able to utilize the vast resources for banking that Bank of America has to offer, it is useful to know the locations of the various branches. "Banking on America, Bank of America".

    Return to list of questions.

  5. Where can I find information on the cost and benefits of using the Internet? While surfing around the Internet, I came across a valuable find. At the University of Michigan, Mr.Mason and Mr.Varlan held a lecture on the costs and benefits associated with using the Internet. The lecture contained information on how prices should be set for people using the Internet. The lecturers stated that, "Prices should reflect costs so people can make intelligent decisions." There are also other interesting lectures on various economic topics on the Internet.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted February 07, 1995 for ICS 1C
